# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

Here is the Julia code for your problem:

```julia
using Dates

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime, bump=3)
    return dt + Hour(bump)
end

# Throw an error when Date type is provided
function timezone_bumper(d::Date, bump=3)
    throw(ArgumentError("Only DateTime can be used. You passed a Date."))
end
```
This function takes two arguments: `dt` which is the timestamp to increase and `bump` which is the number of hours to add (defaults to 3). If you pass a `Date` type, it will throw an error because only `DateTime` can be used.
